text: RT @MCorreaKHOU When asked about #Parkland @NancyPelosi says #Congress can do 3 things to increase safety 1)Expand background checks for all gun purchases 2)Allow the CDC to research mass shootings 3)create a bipartisan committee to discuss other options.  More on #khou11 at 6

RT @VaughnHillyard Pence w/ big head nod, prompting standing O, to Ted Cruz—> “He’s the pride of Texas… President Trump and I want to make sure you send Senator Ted Cruz back to the United States Senate…let me tell you, he’s worked shoulder to shoulder with this president every step of the way.” http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DWSLTZFUQAAC-Ue.jpg
We should not be selling assault weapons in this country. These weapons are not for hunting. They are for killing human beings. These are military weapons.

We must take on the NRA and pass commonsense legislation to keep our children safe.


-Tighten background checks

-End the gun show loophole

-Crack down on people who buy guns legally for people who can’t

-Ban civilian sale of semiautomatic assault weapons

also hear how media again tries to inflame by falsely claiming I said “more guns laws won’t do anything” Real quote? “more gun laws ALONE” https://twitter.com/facethenation/status/965269678481436672 QT @FaceTheNation Hear from 5 Stoneman Douglas high school students about their new movement: #NeverAgain @NeverAgainMSD http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/965269472037629952/pu/img/eYhsEIowMvWG7m2r.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/965269472037629952/pu/vid/320x180/Loli9jwRT4RlEjFR.mp4

Will the Republicans in Congress listen to the American people, or simply obey the dictates of the NRA?
